means: 真正的
真实的
忠实的
正确的
真正地
确实地
正确地
正当地
真理，真实
正，准，精确
摆正
决定（某物）的位置以使其平衡、平稳或水平

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"准确的，正确的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: accurate, exact, precise, right, true, correct
means: accurate ：指通过谨慎的努力达到符合事实或实际，侧重不同程度的准确性，与事实无出入。
exact ：着重在质与量方面的准确，语气比accurate强。
precise ：侧重极端准确，更强调细节的精确无误。
right ：使用广泛，可与这些词中的correct换用，但常暗示道德、理解、行动等方面的正确。
true ：暗指绝对准确，尤指复制品与原件丝毫不差。
correct ：最常用词，主要指按一定标准或规则来衡量，没有谬误和差错或无缺点错误。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含有"忠实的"之意。
means: faithful ： 多指对人对事或对诺言、誓言的始终不渝，侧重在任何情况下都绝不改变。
loyal ： 一般指对祖国、领袖的忠诚或对事业、原则、誓言的忠实，不动摇。
constant ： 侧重指思想状态的稳定或信念的坚定，也指爱情或感情等的忠贞不渝。
true ： 侧重个人感情上的忠实和不动摇。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"真的，真实的，实在的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: genuine, authentic, actual, real, true, factual
means: genuine ： 普通常用词，指真正的，货真价实的，强调非人为或非虚假的。
authentic常可与genuine换用，指与事实完全相符，强调准确可靠。
actual ： 指事物的实际存在，并非出自主观臆造。
real ： 普通用词，含义较广，有时可与actual和genuine换用。指一切真实的或 表面看不出虚假的事物。
true ： 指同实际情况或标准完全一致。口语中多用。
factual与actual同义，但更测重根据事实，不扩大或缩小，不渲染。

word_mean: 具备一切证实其特性所需条件的

sentence.Network_en: As a player he was unselfish, a true team man.
sentence.Network_cn: 作为一名选手，他毫无私念，真正把自己摆在团队中。

sentence.Network_en: But as with other charitable bodies, these figures mask the true picture.
sentence.Network_cn: 但和其他慈善机构一样，这些数字掩盖了实情。

sentence.Network_en: Too much salt masks the true flavour of the food.
sentence.Network_cn: 太多的盐会盖住食物本来的味道。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 真理就是真(true)，故虚谎(lie)断不会从真而出，这道理信徒是会明白的。
当为真(true)时,将忽略浏览器的正常值,就像处理当前元素的border和margin一样.这很好的提升了性能,但要牺牲一些精确性.缺省为false.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English trēowe, tr y̅we 'steadfast, loyal'; related to Dutch getrouw, German treu, also to truce

entry.tran: 基于事实的;真实的;如实的;可信的
entry.def: If something is true, it is based on facts rather than being invented or imagined, and is accurate and reliable.

example.ex: Everything I had heard about him was true...
example.tran: 我听说的关于他的一切都是真实的。

example.ex: He said it was true that a collision had happened…

entry.tran: (感情)真实的，真挚的；（物品）真的，真正的,正品的
entry.def: You use true to emphasize that a person or thing is sincere or genuine, often in contrast to something that is pretended or hidden.

example.ex: I allowed myself to acknowledge my true feelings...
example.tran: 我愿意承认我的真实感情。

example.ex: The true cost often differs from that which had first been projected...
example.tran: 实际成本经常与最初计划的有所不同。

entry.tran: 纯粹的;真正的;名副其实的
entry.def: If you use true to describe something or someone, you approve of them because they have all the characteristics or qualities that such a person or thing typically has.

example.ex: This country professes to be a true democracy…
example.tran: 这个国家自称是真正的民主政体。

example.ex: Maybe one day you'll find true love...
example.tran: 也许有一天你会找到真爱。

entry.def: If you say that a fact is true of a particular person or situation, you mean that it is valid or relevant for them.

example.ex: I accept that the romance may have gone out of the marriage, but surely this is true of many couples...
example.tran: 我同意婚姻里可能已经没有了浪漫这一说法，而且很多夫妻都的确如此。

example.ex: Expenditure on health in most of these countries has gone down, and the same is true for education.
example.tran: 这些国家的医疗支出大多已经下降，教育支出也是如此。

entry.def: You can use true in order to admit that a fact or opinion is real or valid before indicating that you think that it is not important or relevant in the circumstances.

example.ex: It's true she gets madly impatient with him, but what mother doesn't?…
example.tran: 她确实对他极其不耐烦，但哪个母亲不是这样呢？

example.ex: The state, it is true, gave money towards their wages. Nevertheless the whole process had not been organized properly…
example.tran: 诚然，政府已经拨款支付他们的工资。但整个过程没有组织妥当。

entry.tran: 忠实的;忠诚的;恪守(诺言、思想等)的
entry.def: If you are true to someone, you remain committed and loyal to them. If you are true to an idea or promise, you remain committed to it and continue to act according to it.

example.ex: David was true to his wife...
India has remained true to democracy...
example.tran: 印度一直奉行民主政治。

entry.tran: (梦想、愿望或预言)成真，成为现实
entry.def: If a dream, wish, or prediction comes true, it actually happens.

example.ex: Many of his predictions are coming true…
example.tran: 他的很多预言正成为现实。

example.ex: Owning a place of their own is a dream come true for the couple.
example.tran: 这对夫妇拥有了自己的房子，终于梦想成真了。

entry.tran: 同样适用;在…情况下亦然
entry.def: If a general statement holds true in particular circumstances, or if your previous statement holds true in different circumstances, it is true or valid in those circumstances.

example.ex: This law is known to hold true for galaxies at a distance of at least several billion light years.
example.tran: 据知，这条定律同样适用于距离至少几十亿光年之远的星系。

entry.def: If you say that something seems too good to be true, you are suspicious of it because it seems better than you had expected, and you think there may something wrong with it that you have not noticed.

example.ex: On the whole the celebrations were remarkably good-humoured and peaceful. Indeed, it seemed almost too good to be true.
example.tran: 总体上，庆典活动一派快乐祥和。事实上，简直好得让人难以置信。

entry.tran: 栩栩如生;逼真;活灵活现
entry.def: If you say that something such as a story or a film is true to life, you approve of it because it seems real.

example.ex: The opening scenes of this movie are just not true to life.
example.tran: 这部电影开场的几幕真是太假了。

means.word_mean: 1. proper alignment; the property possessed by something that is in correct or proper alignment;
1. make level, square, balanced, or concentric;

sentences.sentence: "true up the cylinder of an engine"

means.word_mean: 1. consistent with fact or reality; not false;

sentences.sentence: "it is undesirable to believe a proposition when there is no ground whatever for supposing it true"- B. Russell

means.word_mean: 2. not synthetic or spurious; of real or natural origin;

sentences.sentence: "the horseshoe crab is not a true crab"

means.word_mean: 5. devoted (sometimes fanatically) to a cause or concept or truth;

sentences.sentence: "true believers bonded together against all who disagreed with them"

means.word_mean: 6. expressing or given to expressing the truth;

sentences.sentence: "I would be true for there are those who trust me"

means.word_mean: 8. not pretended; sincerely felt or expressed;

sentences.sentence: "a spirit which true men have always admired"

means.word_mean: 10. determined with reference to the earth's axis rather than the magnetic poles;
14. reliable as a basis for action;

sentences.sentence: "true, she is the smartest in her class"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 真实的, 真正的, 忠实的
stems_affixes.word_buile: tru相信,真实+e→adj.真实的, 真正的, 忠实的
trust[n.&v.信任, 信赖]+ful表形容词→adj.相信的, 信任的
tru相信,真实+ly表副词→adv.真实地, 不假
tru相信,真实+ce→相信对方而停战
dis不+trust[n.&v.信任, 信赖]→n.不相信,怀疑 v.不信任,疑惑
tru相信,真实+ism学术→真实的学术→不言自明的真理
tru相信,真实+th表名词→n.真实,真相;真实性;真理
tru相信,真实+st→n.&v.信任, 信赖
dis不+trust[n.&v.信任, 信赖]→n.不相信,怀疑 v.不信任,疑惑
en给予+trust[n.&v.信任, 信赖]→给予相信→委托

Sentence.sentence: It sounds almost too good to be true.

If you believe that you have found true romance, and your culture tells you that this is what a long-term relationship should be based on, there is less need to rely on social or family pressures to keep couples together, O'Sullivan argues
You know, Lisa, what they say about pregnant women really is true.
And is it true that some singers use drugs before concerts to boost their voices when they have voice problems?
It made an ancient dream come true
If the time for heel-dragging has been shortened, the true source of the anxiety and panic remains what it has always been.

sentences.en: The story must be true, for I read it in the newspaper.
sentences.cn: 这个故事准是真的, 因为那是我在报上看到的。

sentences.en: Is it true that he has left London?
sentences.cn: 他已离开了伦敦的消息属实吗?

sentences.en: Her true motives only emerged later.
sentences.cn: 她的实际动机是后来才显露的。

sentences.en: Who was the true heir to the throne?
sentences.cn: 谁是真正的王位继承人?

sentences.en: He is always true to his friends.
I think the painter has produced a very true likeness.
sentences.cn: 我认为这位画家画得非常逼真。

sentences.en: You have to admit that these sketches are true to life.
sentences.cn: 你得承认这些素描很逼真。

sentences.en: If the door's not exactly true it won't close properly.
sentences.cn: 这扇门如果安得不正确就关不上。

sentences.en: It would be truer to say that he was careless than that he was unkind.
sentences.cn: 与其说他待人苛刻倒不如说粗心更准确。

jushi.english: I didn't realize the true seriousness of the country's problems until I went there myself.
jushi.chinese: 我亲自到了那里之后才体会到这个国家各种问题的实际严重性。

jushi.english: The whale is a true mammal, even though it may look like a fish.
jushi.chinese: 鲸鱼是典型的哺乳动物,尽管它看上去像鱼。

jushi.english: True gentleman is above envy, jealousy or vindictiveness.
jushi.chinese: 真君子是坦荡而无妒忌、猜疑或报复之心的。
